results.title: Mad Max Beyond Thunderdome
results.credit_line: Courtesy Kennedy Miller Mitchell Films Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: George Miller’s Mad Max revolutionised movies when it tore through cinemas in 1979. Bursting with stunning practical effects, explosive set pieces and iconic costumes, the original Mad Max trilogy (1979-85) cemented its place in pop culture before roaring back to life 30 years later.
results.description:
Taking an unexpected direction from the genre Miller established with his highly influential previous films, Mad Max: Beyond Thunderdome finds our reluctant hero coming face-to-face with the feudal Aunty Entity (Tina Turner), who lords over Bartertown and the deadly battle arena, Thunderdome.

Less emphasis on car chases and more on the brutal tribal world Aunty Entity and her minions reign over, the film sees Max leading a band of feral orphans to freedom. Never fear though, Beyond Thunderdome still bristles with mind-boggling retro-fitted cars, hair-raising stunt work, bizarre costumes and intricate world building to make this third entry into the series as white-knuckled as its predecessors.
description_for_label:
Taking an unexpected direction from the genre Miller established with his highly influential previous films, Mad Max: Beyond Thunderdome finds our reluctant hero coming face-to-face with the feudal Aunty Entity (Tina Turner), who lords over Bartertown and the deadly battle arena, Thunderdome.

Less emphasis on car chases and more on the brutal tribal world Aunty Entity and her minions reign over, the film sees Max leading a band of feral orphans to freedom. Never fear though, Beyond Thunderdome still bristles with mind-boggling retro-fitted cars, hair-raising stunt work, bizarre costumes and intricate world building to make this third entry into the series as white-knuckled as its predecessors.

results.title: Filmo 70DR with light meter
results.brief_description:
Leather custom case housing a 16mm Bell and Howell Company film camera, and a Weston Master Universal Exposure Meter with 2 accompanying booklets housed in their original cardboard storage box.

results.title: Crash Zone: Birthday
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar, Esben Storm, Kevin Nemeth, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Marcello’s unemployed father is acting strangely and Marcello believes he’s cracking up. While Bec has created her own game about gnomes, Marcello becomes convinced his father is going to kill himself. The kids, confused by Pi’s depression, Bec’s game and Marcello’s weirdness, are unsure exactly who is really cracking up.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patricia Edgar, Esben Storm, Kevin Nemeth, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Alcheringa cast and crew
results.credit_line: Courtesy ABC Library Sales / National Archives of Australia
results.brief_description: To Bill Onus, sharing his culture was an act of resistance and reclamation of power. Through Forgotten People(1967) and Alcheringa (1962), Bill demonstrated his ongoing commitment to self-representation through screen culture.
results.credit_line_for_label: Courtesy ABC Library Sales / National Archives of Australia

results.title: Mad Max
results.brief_description: George Miller’s Mad Max revolutionised movies when it tore through cinemas in 1979. Bursting with stunning practical effects, explosive set pieces and iconic costumes, the original Mad Max trilogy (1979-85) cemented its place in pop culture before roaring back to life 30 years later.

constellations_other.name: Evil AI, dystopias and production design
constellations_other.description: In No Code’s sci-fi thriller players take command of a multi-national space station’s artificial intelligence system to help the sole survivor solve the mystery of a missing crew and why the station is wildly off course.

results.description:
Starring the then little known Mel Gibson, this low-budget box-office smash also launched the career of director George Miller and would be followed up by three more sequels. Set in a post-apocalyptic lawless world, Mad Max can be credited for inventing a genre and opening up the global market for Australian films.

The seeds were planted for Miller’s thrilling post-apocalyptic Oscar winning opus, Mad Max Fury Road with his debut film which set the bar for breathtaking car stunts and brutal violence. Using to great effect iconic Melbourne locations such as the Melbourne University car park and Victoria’s expansive country roads, it’s a wonder that this now classic and highly influential film didn’t spearhead an Australian film industry made up of post-apocalyptic road movies.

“Stunts themselves would be nothing without a filmmaker behind the camera and George Miller, a doctor and film buff making his first feature, shows he knows what cinema is all about” - Variety
description_for_label:
Starring the then little known Mel Gibson, this low-budget box-office smash also launched the career of director George Miller and would be followed up by three more sequels. Set in a post-apocalyptic lawless world, Mad Max can be credited for inventing a genre and opening up the global market for Australian films.

The seeds were planted for Miller’s thrilling post-apocalyptic Oscar winning opus, Mad Max Fury Road with his debut film which set the bar for breathtaking car stunts and brutal violence. Using to great effect iconic Melbourne locations such as the Melbourne University car park and Victoria’s expansive country roads, it’s a wonder that this now classic and highly influential film didn’t spearhead an Australian film industry made up of post-apocalyptic road movies.

“Stunts themselves would be nothing without a filmmaker behind the camera and George Miller, a doctor and film buff making his first feature, shows he knows what cinema is all about” - Variety

results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 6. Season 2. Eps 10-13
results.creator_credit: Bernadette O'Mahony, Steve Steve Jodrell, Julie McSwiney, Ray Boseley, David Swann, Disney Channel Australia and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 10: Virgil the A.I. manifests himself within a robotic body and runs away from Catalyst. The kids must track him down before Alex finds out he’s gone. Episode 11: Army Intelligence raid the offices of Catalyst looking for Virgil. The team does all they can to save him from conscription. Episode 12: To her fury, Pi discovers her father is exploiting her on the Net to further his acting career and sets out to show him how she feels. Episode 13: When a game Ram has conquered on the Net turns out to be a scenario for a real-life kidnapping, the team must stop a band of criminals from adopting Ram’s strategy. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv
